Remarks :This Colvic Sunquest 44 (two cabin + dinette layout) designed by John Bennett is a fine example of a powerful flybridge cruiser. 'Emmy B', currently lay in Conwy Marina, was built in 1997 but was not fully commissioned until 2007, her low engine hours are reflective of this. Installed are twin Cummins 6BTA M2 300hp.She has two double cabins, one forward, one starboard, both spacious with good storage facilities + 3 separate seating areas including the flybridge, providing exeptional space for relaxing and entertaining your guests. This power yacht comes with a great specification including navigation equipment at both the upper and lower helm positions, bow thruster, trim tabs, electric windlass, LCD TV, a central station security alarm plus more.                                                                   Accommodation :One double V berth forward cabin with an ensuite heads, shower and sink. good storage plus hanging facilities. A dinette seating area to port, additional heads unit with shower and sink to starboard. Well equipped galley to port with a 4 ring ceramic hob with jet convection grill and rotisseria, fridge, microwave plus sink unit with a pressurised hot and cold water supply. The second double cabin is to starboard, . The lower helm position area and saloon has a double seat for the helm position, and an L shaped seating area with separate sofa with an LCD TV and fridge unit.  A large inviting cockpit area which is accessed via double sliding doors, complete with bench seating and a swim platform. The flybridge is accessed via ladder through the cockpit area, the flybridge has a desirable large sunbed area, central bar with a sink and cool box and seating for 9 people. Eberspacher heating throughout the saloon dinette and both cabins and hot and cold pressurised water systems in all sink and shower units. description: One-off owner version for ocean cruising, fast and comfortable. Exceptionnal unit on the market. Length x beam x draft 14,95 x 4,25 x 2,50 m. LOA 17,25 m. Lead rocket ballast. Superb moulded wooden and strip-planking epoxy construction 2007 by Technologie Marine shipyard on P.Balta architect plans. Owner layout: 2 cabins, 2 bathrooms, saloon with watch bed, galley, navigation corner, technical room, engine room. Professionnal wooden works: makoré and wengé, varnished and white paint. Neo-classic external style, but very modern and powerful hull lines. Very good crossing into the waves. Sailing boat made for short crew sailing (2 to 4/5 crew). Very efficient and full Equipment. 21 m Maréchal mast, full batten main sail, staysail and genoa on furlers, gennaker, spinnaker on carbon pole. Primary electrical winches, davits, roof canvas, bimini top... Volvo engine D2 75 HP, bow thruster, watermaker... Navigation pack B&G, 2 automatic pilots, radar, SSB/Pactor transceiver, Standard C, GPS, Maxsea software, EPIRB and tracking beacons. Independant technical room. Webasto fuel heater, washing machine,electrical toilets. Battery charger/inverter Victron, new. Tender 3 D 3,20 m with Suzuki 6 HP outboard engine. Complete refitting (150000 euros works and equipment). Awlgrip "flag blue" painted September 2017. Many recent equipments. Sailing boat ready to leave for blue waters cruising. To be seen at La Rochelle, west coast of France.

description: AccommodationIn the bow is a V berth with the water tank underneath, opening hatch onto the foredeck. Just to aft of the forecabin is the heads on the starboard side, equipped with marine toilet. A large hanging is opposite. We move into the saloon with a linear galley on the port hand side which has a 2 burner gas hob, grill and oven. Single stainless steel sink with manual freshwasher tap. 100 litre water capacity. Deep dry storage for produce. Opposite is a dinette with a secure table. Settee doubles up as a double berth. In both quarters are another 2 single berths which are rather spacious. Simple and practical fit out through the entire accommodation.Mechanical SystemsUnderneath the companionway as you come down below is a Yanmar 2GM20 18hp engine (age unknown). She is shaft driven with a three blade propellor with rope cutter. Single lever controlled. Engine hours unknown. 40 litre fuel capacity in a stainless steel tank. 5 knot cruising speed. Electrical SystemsTwo 12 volt batteries charged by the alternator. Both batteries are 4 years old.Sails and SparsMasthead sloop rig. Deck stepped alloy mast and boom with stainless steel standing rigging. A frame onboard to lower the mast onto the deck. Terylene running rigging with some led back to the cockpit. Headsail furling system. Slab reefed main with lazy jacks. Two lewmar sheet winches and 1 Barton halyard winch.    Mainsail (2014)    Furling genoa (2016)Deck Equipment    Kobra plough anchor and chain    Mainsail cover    Sprayhood     Various warps and fenders    Dodgers with name    Stainless steel A frame for raising and lowering mast. Includes block and tackle.    Stainless steel boarding ladder on transom.Navigation Equipment    Navman 7100 DSC VHF    Garmin 300C fishfinder    NASA wind    Windex    Sestrel steering compass    Clock and barometer    Deck and masthead navigation lightsSafety Equipment    Cockpit harness points    Electric and manual bilge pumps    Radar reflector    Deck light    Fire blanketConstructionBuilt in 1971 by Eric White of Marine Construction (UK) Ltd and conceived by well known designer Alan Hill. White painted GRP hull with copper coated bottom which was done in 2016. GRP deck with painted non slip patches. Bilge keel with skeg hung rudder. Tiller steering. Fairly large cockpit locker with gas bottle storage inside.

Remarks :Centre Cockpit Wheelhouse Ketch, tax paid and registered for charter in Spain, great opportunity for a live aboard , or charter business, currently in Ibiza with an available berth. This solid wood built 1989 ketch, designed and built in Turkey, offers 8 cabins in total, comprising of 5 single berths, 6 double berths with 8 bathrooms/heads. This motor sailor is powered by her ketch rig and a Volvo Penta 307hp shaft drive inboard. She is ideal for a charter operation having a seating capacity of 40 pax for day charter and a maximum of 18 passengers for overnight. A classic styled yacht with an extensive inventory including full safety equipment and air conditioning. Contact the office to arrange a viewing and further details of this excellent opportunity not to be missed.                                                                  Accommodation :Offering 18 berths for overnight guests in 8 cabins, 6 double berths, 5 single berths and with 8 bathrooms/heads. Spacious saloon and cockpit and vast deck areas ideal for entertaining quests or onboard living. Licenced for 40 day charter passengers and 11 overnight guests. description: Remarks :     Live Aboard Trawler 2013 £215,000“Hannah Mae” has been designed and built as a Live Aboard Trawler Yacht with no expense spared to the quality of workmanship, built in 2013 of steel construction, although only 80% finished it will require the accommodation areas to be finished.                                                                       Accommodation :Accommodation Very large aft cabin in the process of being fitted out with heads and shower, fore cabin extremely large, open to interior design options, both cabins are fully insulated, with electrical wiring in place. Wheelhouse beautifully finished in teak through out, fitted sofa around wheelhouse table for 4-5 people. Helm position with substantial helm seat. Wheelhouse access through port and starboard side doors. Double glazed windows throughout.                                                                   Inventory :Safety Equipment 3 x Life Jackets 3 x Bilge pumps electric  Navigation Equipment 1 x VHF Radio Log & Speed  Deck Equipment 1 x Windlass (Vetus Condor hydraulic) not fitted Swim platform 5 x Warps                                                                   Mechanical and Rigging :Mechanical Systems: The Trawler is powered by a brand new Vetus Deutz DTA66 210hp 6 cylinder turbo charged diesel engine, shaft drive to a 4 bladed bronze propeller giving a cruising speed of approximately 9 knots and a maximum speed of approximately 12 knots, all hydraulic controls. With a fuel capacity of 1600 litres this should have an approximate range of 1100 nm. Also fitted with a Vetus 160 kg hydraulic bow thruster. Electrical Systems: 8 x 12 volt 220Ah batteries all new, charging from the engine alternator, 240 volt battery charger, new Kohler 9KV generator, 240 volt ring mains installed with a Quattro 5KW inverter. Also fitter with hot water tank and immersion heater.

description: Remarks :'Drill n Fill', a Sealine F33 (2002) Flybridge Sports Cruiser with 2 x Volvo KAD32 170hp turbo diesel engines(just 470hrs). ?Full inventory to include a Bow thruster, electric anchor windlass, Eberspacher heating, New Navigation equipment (Full set) plus much more. Superb condition and very well maintained. Viewing highly recommended. Lying Conwy Marina North Wales.                                                                  Accommodation :The interior is warmed by an Eberspacher diesel heating system. The forward cabin has double berth accommodation, hanging lockers and en-suite access to the heads compartment. The heads compartment is to port and has a marine toilet, wash hand basin and shower. There is a second double berth cabin to starboard. Moving aft and up into the saloon the well equipped galley is to port. It has a two burner gas hob, a gas oven/ grill, a microwave oven, a stainless steel sink with hot/ cold pressurised water, a fridge and locker storage. The saloon has 'U' shaped seating around a polished wood dining table and seating and cabinetry opposite. The dining table drops to make a double berth. The helm is to starboard forward and above the saloon with a large helm seat, engine controls and navigation equipment. Both the saloon and forward cabin have Samsung flat screen TV's. Sliding patio doors lead out into the large aft cockpit with access to the bathing platform and steps to port leading up to the flying bridge. The flybridge has helm seats and sun pad seating aft, all controls are repeated at the flying helm. description: LH Boats France est un chantier naval de construction de bateau de plaisance.Lors de la création de notre société, nous avons fixés comme objectif de développer un bateau au design novateur, ergonomique et sécuritaire dans un esprit de personnalisation et offrant à la fois performance et élégance. Le tout au sein d’une ville baignant dans l’industrie nautique depuis 500 ans. De cet objectif est né le LH700, premier bateau 100% normand, 100% Havrais, 100% FrançaisDans une démarche de développement de notre activité. Nous tenons à informer toutes entités intéressées par la construction de leur bateau selon leurs goûts, à la pointe de la technologie et avec un soucis d'élégance de rareté et qui respecte votre budget que c'est désormais possible avec LH Boats France. Analyse de votre besoin, validation des livrables, personnalisation, et respect de votre budget. Notre savoir faire se résume en cinq points importants: DESIGN, ÉMOTION, TECHNOLOGIE, SÉCURITÉ & ERGONOMIE.Nous déclinons nos constructions en plusieurs gammes: à savoir la gamme Sport, Loisir, Travail, balade ( Vous pourrez voir les déclinaisons sur notre site: www.lhboats.frL'écoute, la passion, la satisfaction N'hésitez plus et passez désormais votre Commande de votre unité et défions les mers ensemble. Pour plus d'informations sur notre savoir-faire Ou contactez nous : contact@lhboats.frNous serons très heureux de conduire à bien la construction de votre merveille.PS: Prix indicatif : à partir de 50 000 €

description: Remarks :                                                                  Accommodation :Accommodation is spacious and light, and finished with blue upholstery and teak. The forward cabin has a double berth, a locker with shelving, and storage shelves running along the berth. This cabin has an ensuite heads with a toilet, sink and shower. There is ample amount of storage within the cabin. The saloon is very spacious, with a lovely layout and copious amount of storage. On the starboard side there is a comfortable rectangular seating area, which is ideal for relaxing and socializing. With the seating made of alcantra. There are also 2 deck hatches, coachroof opening and hull side windows, which allows natural light in, creating a light and airy space. The galley is to port which has plenty of worktop space and ample amount of storage. it is equipped with a fridge, double stainless steel sink with pressurized hot and cold water, wooden condiment holder, and a 2 burner store with grill and oven. The navigation station is aft to starboard, which has a large chart table with a comfortable seat and great storage. The aft heads is opposite to navigation centre with a toilet, sink and shower. Both aft cabins have double berths and lockers with shelving. Each cabin has opening  port lights and a deck hatch. description: Remarks :'Luxury' is the word that sums up these South African built Knysna catamarans. For anyone looking at Lagoons and other cats in this price range, this Knysna 500SE (Special Edition) is well worth looking at. It will be clear from even the smallest amount of research into the Knysna company that these yachts are a level above the usual.With an impressive owners suite, taking up the entirety of one of the hulls, this catamaran would make a very stylish liveaboard, or an idyllic escape for the summer months.This particular catamaran has had one owner from new and has been kept in showroom condition. * British Part One Registration* EU VAT paid * RCD Certified OWNERS REMARKS & HISTORY  Launched in December 2013 with final hand over in September 2014 shown at the 2014 Cape Town Boat Show by the boat builder Knysna Yacht Company (Pty). Bespoke design features were incorporated to enhance her global, full time live aboard cruiser features for true comfort and luxurious styling. Thandiwe was subsequently delivered to the 2015 Miami Boat Show in February, after which the owner spent 3 months cruising south through the Caribbean to Grenada where it was kept on the hard on the winter period. The following season the owner spent 3 months cruising back north to the BVI when Thandiwe was then delivered to the Mediterranean where VAT was paid in June 2016 and then subsequently moored in Lefkas Marina, Greece over the winter. The owner spent 2 months cruising the Greek Islands during summer 2017, returning to Lefkas where the boat is now moored. THADIWE – Xhosa tribe of South Africa girls name meaning ‘Loved One’                                                                  Accommodation : Luxury furnishings, fittings and finishing’s throughout  Hand crafted carpentry with a modern Nordic style  The use of light but practical coverings, woods and surfaces creates a feeling of spacious tranquillity LED lighting and dimmers where appropriate LED underwater lighting* 3 en suite Queen sized cabins  Sleeps 6 en suite with 3 additional berths available (Saloon daybed and Forepeak) Very spacious bathrooms featuring wash basin area with separate toilet and large shower  Fully air conditioned  State of the art multi-station entertainment system Apple Mac computer  Port side  Owners cabin extending from aft bedroom to bathroom forward  Open plan carpeted sitting, office space (with satellite phone) and dressing areas  Huge forepeak storage area  Flat screen TV connected to the entertainment and navigation systems  Easy access to washing machine and equipment room  For total privacy, a sliding door seals off the port side from the saloon Starboard Side  Aft stateroom with ensuite bathroom  Mid ships stateroom with ensuite bathroom  Forepeak single berth or storage area  Each stateroom is completely private, air conditioned, fully equipped with lots ofwardrobe and storage space   Saloon and Galley  An open plan saloon and galley with direct, same level access through large glass sliding doors to the cockpit  This light, spacious area combines functionality with high levels of comfort and is designed to maximise both home living and entertainment  The galley offers double area preparation space with full sized four ring gas AEG hob and ELBA oven  Corian surfaces with a serving bar, double sink, Samsung microwave and extensive, flexible storage  Easy access to all refrigeration  The main saloon has a large U shaped couch with a table that seats 8  The table lowers on hydraulic pillars to form a large day or double night bed equally suited for sleeping or group movie viewing State of the art entertainment system with large Samsung flat screen TV and surround sound system  Bar storage and serving area   Cockpit  Large teak table that seats 8 High quality, bright cushioning and screening that allows the cockpit to be used in all weathers  Ice maker and double locker sized refrigeration unit  Large gas BB Direct access to the helmsman position for an integrated and inclusive entertainment  area  STIDD type adjustable helm seat Leather cover on helm wheel  Double entrance to allow ease of movement from the waists and sugarscoops  Outside fresh water hot and cold shower  Swim platform and ladder     SAFETY   Full safety equipment in accordance with Cat A status to ISO standards  Viking Ocean going 8 man life raft  ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT   Tender: Infanta 3.6 metre RIB with a 20hp, 4 stroke Honda outboard motor (with electric  start, power tilt and centre console*)   Apple Mac Mini, keyboard and DVD* Complete inventory of household related equipment  NOTE: ITEMS MARKED *are KYNSNA 500SE non-standard items Lefkas Marina mooring fees paid up to 01/07/2018 description:
Ce DUFOUR 44 est un voilier de croisière familiale offrant de grandes performances grâce à son grand tirant d’eau. Ses dimensions et son agencement permettent d’accueillir un équipage conséquent allant jusqu’à 8 personnes en couchage. description: Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 42i (Model Year 2011) The Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 42i - "AEOLUS" features 3 cabin, 2 heads, a modern galley to port, sliding navigation seat and plenty of seating capacity. The Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 42i offers effortless speed, complete safety, and the added security of a well designed cockpit. Features include a single diesel Yanmar 4JH5E 39KW (54CV) D; spray-hood, bimini, lazy jacks and bag, electric anchor windlass with hand-held remote wired direct, a wide twin helm cockpit with full function cockpit table and three large storage lockers provides the space needed for longer passage-making and use as a live aboard. In addition a full standard charter electronic pack, the boat is offered with a L-shaped galley, sliding navigation station, twin heads with a contemporary design  in 'fine teak' laminated panels and solid wood trim finished in satin UV stabilized varnish. AVAILABILITY: 31st October 2018

La séduction qu'il exerce tient essentiellement à son habitabilité et, à l'extérieur, à sa banquette en arc de cercle et au confortable bain de soleil aménageable à l'avant. La double descente mène, au centre, à l'habitacle, très douillet, et à droite à la mid-cabine indépendante, vaste et dotée de rangements, dont une penderie. Cette configuration ajoute sans aucun doute au charme d'un week-end entre amis. L'habitacle comprend à bâbord un coin cuisine complet et, en face, un grand cabinet de toilette. Le carré en U autour d'une table circulaire se transforme en une grande couchette double. La distribution du cockpit est plaisante avec, d'une part, la banquette double du poste de pilotage et un petit sofa sur bâbord ; et, d'autre part, un coin salon en arc de cercle, transformable en bain de soleil. Pour les déplacements à bord, on apprécie le passavant de bâbord très sécurisant, et le portillon donnant accès à la plage de bain.
Very well equipped, lightly used. Very nic boat.

description: This vessel sustained damage from Hurricane IRMA, and has been deemed repairable by the surveyors.  The pictures in the vessel are from before the Hurricane.  Please contact your Moorings Broker for more detailed information and details on the repairs. Please note photos are not of actual boat only example of same model sistership. 2013 ROBERTSON AND CAINE LEOPARD 48 Crewed – Knot on Call BUILDERS REMARKS: The award-winning Leopard 48 offers blue water performance and comfortable living spaces; this catamaran is a popular member of the Leopard line. The Leopard 48 features a large forward cockpit with direct access from the saloon and a stairway to the forward platform. Other exterior bonuses include a large and open aft cockpit with cockpit table. A raised helm station, providing excellent panoramic visibility, allows for excellent blue water maneuverability. The galley of the Leopard 48 comes equipped with top-of-the-line appliances and ample prepping space. The expertly-designed interior makes sailing not only fun, but also incredibly comfortable. Her modern lines and open floor plan set a new standard for the modern cruising catamaran. BROKERS REMARKS: KNOT ON CALL sustained damage in hurricane IRMA and has currently started repairs. She will receive many new parts in the process and return her former condition if not better with all work. There will be few 48's available this season due to damages and a few less in general over the next years as a result. This boat has the cherry in interior and all the other great features of the 48. Forward seating area, electric davits, Yanmar engines, Northern Lights generator, and air conditioning. She is a crewed model has a few extras on standard spec with flexi teak in cockpit, cockpit fridge, dive bottle rack and extra water tankage.  AVAILABILITY: Due to be released from the fleet on 31st May 2019. May be available sooner please enquire for details.

Remarks :'Dione' is a fantastic example of the popular Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 45.2. Built in 2002, this family-friendly three cabin version is fitted out and maintained to a high standard. MUST BE SEEN and excellent value for money. Lying Conwy Marina.                                                                  Accommodation :SLEEPS 6 in 3 CABINS.  Three cabin layout with large owners cabin forward and two guest cabins aft.  All surfaces are high quality varnished marine teak plywood. Solid laminated teak frames and cappings. White vinyl head-linings with teak battening White vinyl faced centre bulkhead - Installed by professional Ship WrightTeak/holly style laminate floors in heads with access to bilge White GRP moulded heads 2 metre headroom throughout.Description of accommodation from forward: Owner's forward cabin: Double berth with Double Premium quality mattress with stowage beneath. Cupboards aft and ample hanging lockers with further a bespoke hanging locker next to heads. Door access to saloon. Access to en-suite heads compartment with sea toilet, washbasin and shower.Saloon: Positioned to starboard. Substantial U-shaped seating upholstered in an attractive neutral Stone material with further centre-line bench seat. Stowage beneath main settee with further storage beneath bench. Large one-piece table. Locker and shelf stowage outboard. Opening ports and deckhead hatches.Galley: Opposite saloon to port. Linear arrangement with cream Corian worktops. Twin stainless steel sinks, gimballed Dometic stove and new front opening Vitro refrigerator/freezer. Ample locker, cupboard and drawer stowage. Opening ports and deck-head hatches. All cupboard doors have been professionally painted for a modern and fresh look.Navigation area: Aft of saloon to starboard. Large diagonal facing chart table with dedicated seat. Stowage for charts under table and further stowage beneath seat. Panel for mounting navigation instruments. Aft heads: Opposite navigation area to port. Large white GRP moulded heads compartment. Manual marine heads. Stainless steel sink with hot & cold pressurised water supply and shower.Port aft cabin: Large double berth with stowage beneath. Hanging locker and stowage cupboard forward. Starboard aft cabin: Large double berth with stowage beneath. Hanging locker and stowage cupboard forward                                                                  Inventory :Deck Equipment:Anchor, chain and warpElectric anchor windlass – operable from the bow and from the cockpit.Fenders and mooring warpsLarge SprayhoodCockpit bimini to include side curtains to make full cockpit enclosureCockpit seat cushionsNova Spar crane For lifting outboard and MOB retrieval.Boarding LadderTeak laid bathing platformTeak laid cockpit soleFixed cockpit table with cup holders and storage compartmentTransom Shower2x Harken 53ST 2-speed self-tailing manual genoa winches2x Harken 44ST 2-speed self-tailing manual halyard winchesNavigation Equipment:2 x Plastimo binnacle compass (2002)Raymarine GPS/Chartplotter at starboard helm (2015)Raymarine ST60+ Wind (2013)Raymarine ST60 Tridata (Depth, Speed, Log)Raymarine Radar - Mounted on scantrut bracket on mast. (2015)Garmin Fixed VHF c/w Masthead antennaRaymarine ST6001+ Autopilot (2002)All interfaced with Raymarine Seatalk backbone. Depth, Speed and Log are all repeated on port helm.Network Link installed at the chart table for displaying navigational data on to the fixed TV on the saloon bulkhead.Safety Equipment:Gas detectorManual and electric bilge pumpsFire extinguishersFire blanketGas detectorM.O.B harness and lifelineEmergency tiller Radar reflectorFlaresLiferaft 4 person in valase.                                                                  Construction, Mechanical and Rigging :Construction:Jeanneau Sun Odyssey 45.2, built in 2002 by Chantiers Jeanneau to a design by Philippe Briand.Iron ballast fin keel. The keel is protected from corrosion by an epoxy treatment. GRP balanced spade rudder with stainless steel stock and two self-aligning bearings.The hull is built from hand-laid solid laminate monolithic fibreglass. Stresses are distributed over the whole bottom surface by means of floors integral with the hull. The hull is finished in a white gelcoat with blue waterline hull stripes. The deck and superstructure is constructed using GRP with a balsa-wood sandwich for increased insulation against heat and sound. Hard wood inserts are positioned beneath any deck fittings. The deck is joined to the hull by polyester bonding and further reinforced by a bolted aluminium toe-rail. The cockpit sole and bathing platform are overlaid in teak with further teak on the cockpit seating.Mechanical:Yanmar 4JH 3TE 75 HP diesel engine, conventional shaft drive to a fixed three bladed propeller. Cruising speed: approx 7 knots @ 2,200rpmMaximum speed: approx 7.5 knotsFuel consumption @ cruising speed: ¾ gallon per hourFisher Panda 4KVA Generator complete with fresh water flush connection Electrics:2 x 12v Domestic batteries and 1 x 12v engine battery (All Exide Batteries - Replaced 2015) - SwitchedSolar panelSterling 40 amp/hr Pro-charger Battery charger80 amp/hr Engine alternatorShore-power & 3 x 20 metre cablesDC panel with voltmeter and Ammeters for alternator and battery chargerAC panel with voltmeterAir-conditioning  Water:Hot and cold pressurised water supply.Hot water via engine calorifier and 240v immersion heater.Spars and Rigging:Sparcraft aluminium anodised sparsDeck-stepped masthead rig with two sets of swept-back spreadersIn-mast furlingGenoa roller furlingStainless steel 1x19 wire standing rigging with bottle-screw protectors - Replaced 2013.Split stainless steel wire backstay (2013)Rod-vang with Harken block & tackle adjustmentHarken cockpit-adjustable genoa tracksHarken jib tracks on foredeckHarken mainsheet system with adjustable travellerSpinlock jammers Sails Wardrobe:Furling Mainsail - New 2008Genoa (130%) - New 2008Cruising chute - New 2008

description: L'incontournable du peche promenade. Révision moteur et antifouling fait en janvier 2018  Visible sur Cannes Marina. heures moteur non contractuel, données à titre indicatif

The Westerly Pentland is a bilge keel ketch with a deep and safe centre cockpit. A robust cruiser with steady sailing performance, spacious interior and a separate aft cabin. The Pentland is one of five Westerly models based on the same Laurent Giles designed hull, Berwick, Longbow, Renown and Westerly 31 being the others. The Westerly Pentland hull is slightly extended by a short plank bowsprit.

AccommodationThe Beneteau Oceanis 36CC accommodation offers up to six berths in three cabins with approximately 6'4“ maximum headroom.FORECABIN: Double V berth with stowage beneath, shelves, two hanging lockers and opening hatch to foredeck.SALOON: A light and comfortable space fitted with an L-shaped settee to port and a single settee berth to starboard either side of a central table with folding leaves and storage. Further storage beneath berths and in various lockers with lots of natural light and ventilation provided by various opening portlights, hatches and fixed windows.GALLEY: A large linear galley runs aft along the port side equipped with a 2-burner gas cooker with oven, twin stainless steel sinks, large fridge, freezer and excellent stowage and worktop space.  CHART TABLE: The forward facing chart table, located to starboard, is of a good size and has navigation equipment, an electrical distribution panel and storage areas.HEADS: Aft to starboard is the heads compartment which can be accessed from the saloon or aft cabin and is fitted with a marine toilet, shower, washbasin and storage.AFT CABIN: Access to the spacious aft cabin is via the galley walkway or the heads and has a large double berth offset to starboard, with a curved settee opposite, hanging lockers, opening hatch to aft deck and en suite access to the heads compartment.GENERAL EQUIPMENT: Large 420 litre water capacity supplying hot and cold pressurised water to galley and heads via a calorifier with immersion coil. Eberspacher diesel fired warm air heating system. LCD TV and CD/radio stereo system. Green and white striped upholstery with matching curtains. Attractive teak finish interior with moulded white headlinings and teak and holly sole boards. Ample stowage throughout for extended periods on-board.Mechanical SystemsLocated under the cockpit, Volvo 2030 MD 3-cylinder 28hp diesel engine. Freshwater cooled via heat exchanger. Single lever controls with electric start. Shaft drive with Stripper rope cutter fitted to 3-bladed propeller. 120 litre fuel capacity giving approximately 250 mile range at 6 knots cruising speed. Sidepower SE80 bow thruster with remote control. Electrical Systems4 x 12v batteries ( two domestic, engine start and dedicated bow thruster) charged via engine alternator with split charging relay. Shorepower system with ring mains and immersion coil for water heating. Electrical distribution panel with battery breakers. Full cabin lighting throughout.Sails and SparsMasthead rigged bermudan sloop. Silver anodised aluminium mast and boom. Solid strut kicker. Stainless steel standing rigging (new 2016). Terylene running rigging. In-mast furling mainsail. Facnor headsail furling system. All lines led aft to cockpit via 6 Spinlock jammers and single Lewmar 30 self tailing halyard winch. 2 x Lewmar 44 self tailing sheet winches.      Mainsail - very good (serviced and valeted 2014)    Furling Genoa - very good (serviced and valeted 2014)Deck Equipment    Plough type anchor with 50m of chain and warp    Electric anchor windlass with remote control    Stainless steel pulpit, pushpit, boarding ladder, stanchions and guardwires    Fixed cockpit windscreen and green sprayhood     Binnacle cover and boom awning     Lifeline gates aft    8 x Fenders    4 x WarpsNavigation Equipment    Plastimo steering compass on binnacle    VHF radio    B&G Network Quad depth, speed and log on binnacle    B&G Network wind instrument on binnacle    B&G Network autopilot on binnacle with hydraulic ram     B&G GPS chartplotter with local charts    AIS receiver    Wifi booster and modem    LCD TV in saloon    Radio/CD stereo with speakers    Masthead and deck level navigation lights    Local paper chartsSafety Equipment    Fire extinguishers    Automatic fire extinguisher in engine compartment    Fire blanket    Gas alarm and carbon monoxide detector    Echomax radar reflector    Webbing jackstays    Harness points    Seago 6-man liferaft in canister (new 2016)    Horseshoe lifebuoy    Danbuoy    Manual and electric bilge pumpsConstructionBeneteau Oceanis 36CC built in 2002 by Beneteau Yachts to a design by Jean Berret. White GRP hull with green styling stripes, superstructure and GRP non-slip decks. Cast iron fin keel. Wheel steering to spade rudder. Centre self draining cockpit with teak laid cockpit seating and sole. Integral self draining anchor locker.

description: 1981 Sigma 3300D: "Charisma" is a 1981 version of this well-known fractional rig, one-design cruiser/club racer developed by Sigma with designer David Thomas. This example has hardly been used at all over the last 4 years, however, she has been hauled and antifouled annually. The boat was used weekly between April -October up to 2013, and since has been sparsely sailed by the owner over the last 4 years.  Comprehensive sail wardrobe in good condition and lightly used.  Inside cabin is in very good condition, floorboards, woodwork, cushions, and ceiling tacking. Cooker – end of life. Toilet – replaced 10 years ago – hardly used. Reason for low Price Point;   Boat currently in need of osmosis treatment for her lower hull.  Rigging will need an inspection this year, in particular in the areas around the J-brackets which are a well known weak spot on Sigmas.

This boat will not disappoint any prospective buyer and viewings are welcome

description: Remarks :A very well presented Beneteau Oceanis 343 lift keel version in very good condition throughout and with every possible upgraded. Bahama Mama has everything that makes cruising fun and comfortable. For those whose priority is sailing she has a new genoa, very good main and a Kemps cruising chute and snuffer. Her in-mast reefing systems makes for simple single or short handed sailing. Her navigation package includes a large screen Raymarine C80 plotter with Radar and full AIS functions. She is fitted with a Raymarine ST6062 Smart pilot Autohelm. Her Side-power bow thruster makes easy work of the trickest manoeuvre is any marina.   As for comfort she has pressurised hot/cold water in her two showers, galley and heads. The Wallis hot air heater is a high quality system with outlets in both cabins, saloon and heads. The Vitrifrigo front opening fridge has a freezer compartment with ice tray. Her cabins are bright and comfortable as is her saloon with a large folding table. She has ample storage for extended cruising. She also has a full cockpit canopy in very good condition. For entertainment there is a radio/cd player and TV with freeview.   This Beneteau 343 is the sort after Lift Keel version giving a shallow draft of 1.2m and over 2m with the keel down, giving great windward sailing qualities.   This is Beneteau is in really tip-top condition and represents excellent value for money.                                                                  Accommodation :The Beneteau 343 has 6 berths in two cabins, she has the owner version layout. The aft cabin has a large double berth with 6ft 2 head heigth inside the doorway.There is a hanging wardrobe. The forward cabin is a twin v berth with a fill in .There is shelving along the hull and a hanging locker. She has a large saloon with two settee berths and a folding dinning table. The heads have over 6ft of headroom , a hot water shower and a vanity unit.                                                                    Inventory :Bow thruster Full cockpit tent Raymarine VHF/DSC Raymarine repeater vhf in cockpit Raymarine C80 Raymarine ST 60 Tridata Raymarine ST60 Wind speed and direction Raymarine ST6062 Smart Pilot Autohelm TV/dvd player Kenwood FM radio/CD Fire blanket Fire extinguisher Full set of cockpit cushions                                                                  Mechanical and Rigging :Yanmar 3YM30 Side -power bow thruster Electric windlass 4 x Harken 2 speed winches Swivel wheel Full cockpit tent Manual bilge pump Electric bilge pump Hot water calorifier Wallis Hot air heating system Sanders mainsail New 2017 Genoa Spare main and genoa (usable) Kemp cruising chute with snuffer Anchor chain and warp Fenders and warps Vitrifrigo refrigerator with freezer compartment and ice tray, front opening 3 x batteries Battery monitor Shore power with intelligent battery charger Cotek invertor Holding tank

description: 40' Beneteau First 40 (2011) Stylish and fast, this latest racer-cruiser has already won the Sydney-Hobart Race. BUILDERS COMMENTS: Designed by Bruce Farr, the Beneteau First 40 does an admirable job of blending a truly fast hull with a very stylish interior. The interior has been designed by Nauta Design and is finished in an Alpi blond oak which certainly adds a touch a class and comfort throughout the vessel. The First 40 is built somewhat conservatively with a solid hull and cored deck and accessible areas on deck covered in "picot" type non-slip surface. The galley is immediately to port when you come below. It’s well thought out, with stainless steel sink facing forward, a good sized icebox/fridge and a two-burner stove with oven/ grill. The wraparound navigation station is opposite the galley and is the best feature of the interior. It includes a chart table and a desk, perfect for a computer, and plenty of room for radios and repeaters. The saloon includes settees port and starboard with storage above.  BROKERS COMMENTS: SUNSAIL 4003 continues the tradition of the First 40.7 and is a thoroughbred amongst racer/cruisers. The interior layout is modern and comfortable and yet the First 40 has had highly impressive racing results, showing a winning combination of style and performance. The Beneteau First 40 is a proven winner already. Below the forward cabin offers a V-berth, a dressing chair and a small hanging locker. The head is to starboard and is surprisingly spacious.There are two equal double cabins aft and the saloon has one single berth to port and one starboard. A centerline table opens up to allow seating for most of the crew. The Beneteau First 40 is a performance boat that we can all aspire to, and that’s vital in these difficult times. It is designed for “like” racing, not one-design, and that’s also important today. This boat appeals on many levels to be sure, but what will assure the success of the First 40 is the fact that it lives up to its name.  AVAILABILITY:  1st November 2018 All viewings by prior appointment only please. Our office hours are Monday - Friday, 0900am to 1730pm.

She delivers high performance with her twin 490-hp Cummins 8.3 and only 525 engine hours. The Tiara 3800 is a rugged offshore fishing boat with the features and amenities of a family cruiser. Remarks :Chris-Craft Sportsman 17 for sale. The Chris-Craft Sportsman was built from 1953-1959 and was was one of Chris-Craft’s most popular boats, it was designed as a basic entry level utility boat.  The Chris-Craft name is synonymous with classic wooden powerboats. The hull is made out of solid mahogany planking with matched light and dark grains on both sides with the Chris- Craft decal on side.  The details continue on the bow with a chrome light assembly and a Chris Craft flag.  Framed, curved Plexiglass windshield. This boat will be a head turner wherever she is seen - she attracted admiring glances when she was outside our office on her trailer. Imported from Florida, USA in 1990, in the current ownership for 14 years (unused).                                                                  Accommodation :The interior is highlighted by the white steering wheel and the classic controls and gauges.  The sleek styling and flowing lines of this Sportsman have automotive like feel reminiscent of the times.  Upholstery in Rosewood vinyl with white piping. Seating is offered at the stern with room for 3 and the forward seating has a space between to allow movement with seating for 2.  There is ample space for storage items under the bow and alongside the seating.  Access to wiring and controls is also under the dash.                                                                  Inventory :General Equipment:  Trailer                                                                   Construction and Mechanical :Wooden Chris-Craft Sportsman 17. Built in 1957 by Chris-Craft. HIN:# L200459   Chris - Craft was founded in 1874 by Christopher Smith in Detroit, Michigan. Specialising in luxury pleasure boats, timeless design, exquisite detailing and authentic craftsmanship are aspects which are intrinsic to Chris-Craft boats.  The Chris-Craft Sportsman was built from 1953-1959 and was was one of Chris-Craft’s most popular boats, it was designed as a basic entry level utility boat.  The utility boats were born in the depression years but usurped the runabouts as the sportiest boats in the Chris-Craft line-up.  If you are in the market for an antique and classic boat, look no further than this 1957 Chris-Craft Sportsman 17, Chris-Craft name is synonymous with classic wooden powerboats. The hull is made out of solid mahogany planking with matched light and dark grains on both sides with the Chris Craft decal on side.  The details continue on the bow with a chrome light assembly and a Chris Craft flag.  Framed, curved Plexiglass windshield. Imported from Florida in 1990, in the current ownership for 14 years (unused). Remarks :Scanmar 33. Designed by Rolf Magnussen and built by Borjesson Brothers (Scanmar AB), Sweden, in 1989. Constructed of hand laid GRP with off-white topsides and distinctive red hull bands. Teak decking on cockpit seats, with teak sole grating. A well planned, 3/4 fractional rigged, Bermudan sloop from a recognised Swedish yard,  “Scintilla of Poole” has a fin keel, supported skeg rudder and wheel steering. Volvo Penta 27HP 2003 diesel inboard sail drive regularly serviced engine, new sail drive leg 2012, Isomat alloy spars.  Fully battened main, slab reefing, furling head sail, genoa, and coaster with bag. Standing rigging replaced 2015, She sleeps 6/7 in two cabins with 2 double berths and 3 single. Separate heads and heating.  A fast, easily handled boat, rigged for shorthanded crews with all halyards and lines led to the cockpit. Very well equipped with many extras including holding tank, shore power, 3 x batteries, cabin heating, compass, speed, wind, Garmin GPS, Simrad plotter, Nasa clipper log and echo sounder, Raytheon radar, Autopilot, VHF plus hand held VHF, bronze folding prop, spray hood, dodgers, engine spares, and many other extras. Remarks :The Rival 36 designed by Peter Brett and built by Southern Yachts is a  high quality yacht with a proven sailing reputation for its ability to make safe, comfortable passages of any duration. 'Topaz' is in tip-top condition throughout, her hull was laid down in 1990 but she was professional fitted out in 1996 by Rossitor's boat yard ,Christchurch. Since then she has been lightly used for short coastal passages around the Solent area. So she is really in excellent condition, her sails and engine both regularly serviced but all lightly used. She has wheel steering with a ST4000 autohelm. All her lines are led back to the cockpit and she has in mast in mast reefing and roller genoa, making her very easily sailed short or single handed.   She has shore power and a hot water calorifer ,with a shower in the heads, the galley has a refrigerator, oven ,grill and two burners .There is plenty of storage throughout. This is a very capable sea going yacht in great condition.                                                                  Accommodation :The Rival 36 has a quality teak finnished interior which is in very good condition, as is the upholstery throughout . She sleeps 5 . The forward main cabin has a en suite facility , a twin berth with a fill in to make up a double, and storage around the hull. The saloon has two settee berths  with under seat storage. The dinning table folds and is very large. The galley has hot water ,twin sinks, oven ,grill and two burners. There is a  Isotherm fridge unit.  The heads has a hot water shower stainless steel sink,and mirror.                                                                  Inventory :Shore power St 4000 Autohelm Radar Radar reflector VHF radio Shipmate GPS RS 5700 Speed /log depth Isotherm fridge Oven ,grill,two burners Binnicle steering compass Solar panel battery charger                                                                  Mechanical and Rigging :Bukh 36 Shore power Hot and cold pressurized water Main Genoa Spinaker Spinaker pole Furlex roller reefing In-mast reefing All lines lead back to the cockpit Stainless steel pilpitand pushpit Teak toe rail Side gates port and starboard 6 Lewmar winches Folding boarding ladder on stern Electric bilge

description: AccommodationThe layout offers up to five berths with two separate sleeping cabins. There is full standing headroom, good ventilation, and plenty of storage throughout. In the fore cabin, large V-berth, with opening hatch to foredeck. Aft of the fore cabin is the head to stb. with separate shower, sink, and marine toilet; and large hanging locker to port. This is followed by the galley with a stand-alone fridge/freezer, ample counter space and a propane cook-top to stb. To port is a micro-wave and large s/s sink. Hot and cold pressurized water. Separated by a partial bulkhead is the navigation station to port and a U-shaped, oyster colored, ultra-suede dinette to stb. with a folding table athwartship. Separating the dining area from the navigation station is the companion way ladder to the center cockpit. Aft of the navigation station is the passageway that leads to the after stateroom with access to the engine room which is situated under the cockpit. The aft stateroom is large with a double bed on centerline, an ensuite head to stb. with separate shower and a large hanging locker to port at the end of the passageway. Mechanical SystemsLocated centrally behind the companionway ladder is the large engine room. Ford Otosan diesel engine, electric start, freshwater cooled via heat exchanger. Single lever control, 4 bladed fixed prop. The engine has less than 500 hours. Adjacent to the engine is the Onan 8 kw generator and a 40 gal/hr. watermaker. Both the engine and generator draw from the 757 litre fuel tank. Various engine spares with service history.Electrical Systems    9 x 12-volt service batteries    Alternator, Solar Panel and wind generator charging    Onan 8 kw 120 v. genset.    Xantrex battery charger    Tri-Star TS-MPPT 45 solar charger    120 AC outlets;    Inverter    120 AC shore powerSpars and SailsMasthead ketch rigged. Aluminum mast(s), boom(s), Stainless steel standing rigging. Running rigging recently replaced. Slab reefing mainsail with stackpack. Headsail and staysail furling systems. 4 x Lewmar sheet winches, 3x single speed halyard winches. New green sail covers with name on. Le Cornish Shrimper est le modèle le plus populaire avec un style classique qui séduit les marins de toutes générations et une qualité de construction qui a conduit à sa réputation de meilleur Gaffer de production britannique de tous les temps. 
Fait inhabituel pour un bateau de cette taille, la version standard du moteur hors-bord peut être améliorée pour prendre un Yanmar 9hp Diesel inboard. Cela la distingue des autres marins sur le marché.

L'habitacle auto-drainant est spacieux comparé aux autres bateaux de sa taille.
Un faible tirant d'eau et une quille relevable permettent de naviguer vers des criques tranquilles.
Chaque bateau est construit sur commande avec des couleurs extérieures et l'aménagement intérieur fini à votre goût.

LE MOT DU PROPRIETAIRE:
Nous avons acheté Eclipse en 2007 pour faire un tour du monde avec Marie mon épouse.
Un an de préparation.
Nous sommes partis en Septembre 2008.
2008-2009: Madère- Canaries- Cap Vert- Fernando de Norona- Brésil- Uruguay, mise à terre.
2009-2010: Argentine Ushuaia- Puerto William- Antarctique- canaux de Patagonie- Carénage à Puerto Monts.
2010-2011: île Robinson Crusoé- île de Pâque- les Gambiers- Les Marquise- île sous le vent- mise à terre à Raiatea.
2011-2012: île Niué- Tonga- Wallis- Nouvelle Calédonie- Nouvelle Zélande, carénage à Nelson.
2012-2013: Hobart pour l'arrivée de la course Sydney-Hobart- Sydney- Nouvelle Calédonie- Vanuatu- Polynésie îles sous le vent- mise à terre à Raïatea.
2013-2014: Tuamotou- Gambiers- Panama- Antilles- Grenadines- mise à terre en Martinique.
2014-2015: Martinique- Açores- rivière d'Auray.
Navigation par an: le moins 6 mois en mer. Le plus 9 mois.
notre avis: un bateau très équipé et en parfait état grace à un entretien rigoureux de son propriétaire passionné et connaisseur

Ce navire de 30 tonnes bi moteur gréé en KETCH est une invitation au voyage que ce soit dans les pays chaud ou froid grace à sa coque isolée. Sa construction robuste signée ALM HOLLANDE permet effectivement de se laisser prendre par les glaces..Son autonomie de 4000l DE GASOIL(2200milles nautiques à 5 nds) -2000L D'eau et de 1590 l de réservoir eau grise/noire vous permet d'envisager plus qu'un voyage mais de vrais expéditions au long cours . Ce bateau à salon de pont propose une timonerie extérieure sur le chateau arrière, et une timonerie intérieure pour le gros temps ou les grands froids avec une vision panoramique à 360 degré et beaucoup de grand hublot ouvrant permettant une vraie ventilation sous les tropiques!
Coté intérieure, la clarté domine dans une ambiance cosue et robuste avec du vrai teck travaillé à l'ancienne, des aménagements fonctionnels avec beaucoup de rangement mélant incroyablement bien un style tradion tout en etant moderne..
sous le chapiteau arrière se cache une belle cabine propriétaire, avec tv, douche séparée et wx à part dans un style chaleureux. le poste de timonerie intérieure est un vrai poste de veille, avec tout l'électronique de bord, gps lecteur de cartes, radar, pilote auto, vhf , navtex, et speedo -sondeur girouette anémo mais aussi une couchette de veille, un coin repas et une cuisine américaine sur l'arrière, moderne et fonctionnel avec tout le confort et les ustenciles de cuisine digne d'un 4 étoiles!
En contrebas, sur l'avant un troisième niveau avec encore beaucoup de hublot ne donnant pas l'impression d'etre à la cave, un énorme carré avec une grande table à cartes et de nombreux rangements sur babord, et en face un espace repas, salon avec un vrai canapé convertible, couchage 1.60m partout, et une cabine de mer avec lit décalé sur la partie avant qui laisse entre les deux la place pour une douche séparée et un grand wc en face, accueillant le lave linge....
Vous l'aurez compris, Avallon, est un vrai beau bateau solide et marin, construit pour aller partout et affronter tout type de temps en toute sérennité en ayant des espaces de vies séparées, spacieux et très agréables sur plusieurs niveaux permettant la paix des ménages et le respect de chacun, que ce soit en famille ou entre explorateurs avertis.
La sale des machines permet l'entretien des 2 moteurs, du désallinisateur ou du groupe électrogène dans le confort et propose un vrai coin atelier et de nombreuses solutions de stockage pour le matériel technique. une grande soute arrière permet de stocker l'annexe et son moteur qui à également sa place sur l'arceau arrière qui intègre fonction bossoir, en autre!
Si vous recherchez un bateau bien entretenu, pret à partir immédiatemment, demandez nous l'inventaire détaillé...Mais il est sur qu'à ce prix AVALLON EST UNE SUPERBE OPPORTUNITE POUR REALISER TOUS VOS PROJETS LES PLUS FOUS VERS DE NOUVEAUX HORIZONS LOINTAINS!

Le whaly 435 est un bateau résistant à double coque, fabriqué à partir de matériaux synthétique de haute qualité (polyéthylène), et quasiment insubmersible et indestructible. Facile à entretenir, ce bateau est produit avec des peintures 100 % inaltérables. Laissez-vous convaincre.
Spécifications Whaly 370 :
Matériel : Polyéthylène moulé par rotation (100% recyclable), stabilisé au UV, construction d'une seule pièce à double coque.
Tirant d'eau 0.52 m
Poids : 184 Kg
Nombre maximum de personnes: CE cat. D 12 personnes /cat. c 8 personnes

Moteur puissance maximale : 30CV  (22 kW)
Couleurs disponibles : 
Gris/Rouge/Orange/Bleu/Jaune/noir/marine/gris foncé/Vert foncé/marron clair
Possible de mettre en option :
jeux de rames/console de pilotage/siège avec rangement banc/siège d'avion avec rangement

Nous vous proposons un pack avec :
 console plus un banc plus montage plus remorque plus 30 cv Tohatsu prix TTC : 8435 eu au lieu de 9969 eu TTC

Même offre avec un 30 cv Honda : 9935 eu TTC au lieu de 11 973 eu TTC

Prix coque nue : 2260 eu TTC au lieu de 3222 eu TTC

Le Merry Fisher 625 est d'abord un joli bateau de croisière et de pêche qui bénéficie de nombreux équipements pratiques et modernes
Equipement : cockpit autovideur - liston de protection de coque - anneau de treuillage - davier - 2 chaumards avant - 2 taquets d'amarrage avant - 2 taquets d'amarrage arrière - balcons inox - balcons de cockpit arrière - mains courantes de cockpit - mains courantes de timonerie - direction mécanique - support d'instrumentation moteur - feux de navigation - compas de route - vitrages frontaux en verre - vitrages latéraux ouvrants - baie arrière vitrée coulissante - réservoir de carburant avec nable extérieur - pompe de cale - support de moteur hors bord auxiliaire - banquette arrière de cockpit - coussins de banquette arrière - panneau de pont de timonerie - panneau / hublot de pont de cabine - coffre de plancher de cockpit - echelle de bain - porte cannes - rangement à cannes - - carré  transformable en couchage double - coffres sous les banquettes - evier polyester - rechaud gaz - wc chimique - electronique récent GARMIN - bimini toile
BANC DE COCKPIT- PIED DE TABLE EXTERIEUR
-  deuxième essuie glace - 
Belle opportunité -
Ce peche croisière est idéal pour se ballader dans la région et a un véritable programme mixte: ballade, croisière cotière , partie de pêche entre amis...il vous propose une multitude de plaisirs en mer et possède les principaux éléments de confort au port- EXCELLENT RAPPORT QUALITE PRIX A SAISIR VITE!!

Le Fantasia 27, ici en version "dériveur lesté", est un voilier monocoque de 7.7m dessiné par Philippe Harlé. Il a été construit en monolithique fibres de verre / polyester, par Jeanneau (France) entre 1982 et 1991 en 1743 exemplaires.
En partie restauré en 2013/2014
- Moteur 300h  
- Electricité, circuits gaz et eau refaits en 2013
- Haubans, étai avec enrouleur, patara changés en 2015
- Tous les organes mécaniques (échangeur, pompe à eau, vannes) et voilistiques ont été refaits ou changés lors de la restauration
- Electronique 2013
- Joints wc 2013
- Presse étoupe 2017
- coque lustrée au Politrol à chaque carénage 
- Carré avec table, table à carte, cuisine avec réchaud gaz 2 feux / évier / glacière
- Cabinet de toilette avec wc marins
- Lit breton 2 places à l'avant
- Cabine arrière 2 places
- Spi   tangon
- Mouillage lourd
- Béquilles d'échouage
- Homologué pour 6 passagers (en sortie journée)
- Très confortable en croisière autonome en couple avec 2 enfants

Les bateaux Whaly sont fabriqués d'une seule pièce en matériau synthétique par rotomoulage avec une construction double coque. Cela garanti une robustesse et une stabilité unique.
Ils conviennent à merveille pour un usage récréatif. Ils peuvent également être utilisés à des fins professionnnelles (bateau école de voile, pompiers).
Ils peuvent être utilisés pour :
Navigation de plaisance,
Canots et annexes,
Bateaux utilitaires,
Actions de sauvetage,
Société de location,
Bateau d'accompagnement,
Pêche,
Ski Nautique,
Plongée,
Navigation électrique.

Le Whaly 500 peut naviguer avec 12 personnes, aucun autre bateau rotomoulé n'accepte autant de passagers conmpte tenu de sa taille.
Le whaly à également un point important, son entretien très facile avec uniquement avec de l'eau savonneuse.
100 % recyclable

Oceanis 31 de 2016, très peu servi, comme neuf !

Les voiles (génois et GV) sont de 2017, en Hydranet avec bande UV pour le génois, et une Magnifique grande voile full batten !

Bien équipé : Finition essential 2016 : Electronique 1 Afficheur B and G T41 Graphic loch speedo sondeur, girouette anémo, Guindeau électrique et télécommande, frigo 12V, Audio Fusion avec HP exterieur et interieur, Eclairage LED intérieur, Circuit électrique 220V avec prise de quai et chargeur de batteries., 2 hublots ouvrants supplémentaires (jupe et cockpit) 1 batterie 70A supplémentaire.

Pack électronique B and G (en plus du sondeur speedo loch) GPS traceur lecteur de carte multifonction 7 pouces modèle Zeus wide avec cartographie navionics et interface Wifi. Pilote auto B and G AC42 (gyrocompas inclus) et VHF à la table à carte B and G V50 avec récepteur AIS.  Switch VHF/Audio pour la veille.

Gréement de spi asymétrique, patara réglable, housse de barre à roue, Capote de roof, douchette de cockpit eau chaude / eau froide, pompe à pied eau de mer, Coupe Orin D25.

Radeau de survie 4 place

Une très grand cabine arrière, avec hublot sur la jupe. Beaucoup de rangements, coffre et penderie, très grand coffre dans le cockpit extérieur.

Très belle version loft (cabine avant ouverte, avec des rideaux pour la nuit) offrant une très belle luminosité, de grandes aérations, et un espace unique dans cette catégorie de bateau.

Capote, lazy bag, selleries, tout est hiverné au sec. Vraiment comme neuf, avec l'avantage d'être fiabilisé en plus !

Reprise de LOA très intéressante : 44507,16 € TTC restent à financer au 05/09/2017

Une occasion très rare, comme neuf, seulement 1 an, avec une possibilité de financement très intéressante ! (abattement de TVA sur les loyer de LOA)

Très belle Princess 415 de 1990, millésime 1991, 12.95m hors tout.
Motorisé en deux fois 306CV Volvo penta TAMD 61 A, environ 1500 heures. Révisé et entretenu, prêt à partir.
Propulseur d'étrave.
La coque à bénéficié d'un traitement curatif anti-osmose très poussé : Séchage pendant un an et demi, garantie 6 ans depuis 6 juillet 2016. LE rouf, le salon de pont, le fly bridge, le portique ont été laqués en 2016 d'un verni polyuréthane bi-composant Alexeal appliqué au pistolet par un professionnel.
Guindeau électrique Lofrans.
Beaucoup de rangements sur le flybridge, ainsi que beaucoup d'assises.
Dans le cockpit : grandes baies ouvrantes sur le carré, Flybrdige et cockpit complètement protégé par des toiles avec ouvertures et fenêtre, le tout en très bon état. Le gorupe électrogène se trouve dans le coffre arrière sur babord.
A l'intérieur : Isolation complètement refaite au sol, bois et vernis en très bon état, mes éclairages sont en LED.
Un frigo dans le carré, en plus de celui dans la cuisine. EAu chaude et eau froide. Les feux standards ont été remplacé par des plaques vitro-céramiques, un micro-onde, évier double bac, de nombreux rangements.
Ensuite, deux belles cabines, la cbine double à l'avant et une avec deux lits simple plus en arrière, avec chacune leur salle d'eau.
Au poste de pilotage nous avons : Le retour du radar, la vhf, le pilote automatique, les doubles commandes de moteur, un GPS traceur 7 pouces.
Une habilité exceptionnelle, de bonnes performances, une qualité de construction rare !

Aucun compromis dans la fabrication, des qualités remarquables, c'est ce qui a fait le succès de toute une génération d'Antarès et que perpétue l'Antares 680.
S'offrir une véritable randonnée, remonter un aber jusqu'au plus profond de son origine, partir à la découverte d'une calanque inaccessible par la terre et profiter de ce mouillage tranquille. Voilà le programme que vous offre l'Antarès 680. L'Antarès 680 bénéficie de la carène à double tunnel créée et brevetée par André Bénéteau, qui optimise à la fois vitesse et confort à la mer, sécurité et stabilité de route. De part et d'autre de la quille qui prolonge le V de l'étrave, se profilent deux tunnels. Ils se prolongent au delà de la quille et se rejoignent avant le tableau arrière pour former une voûte qui abrite l'hélice et le safran. La tenue de cap est étonnante quelles que soient les conditions de mer, même à vitesse réduite.

Toujours entretenu, Motorisé en 80CV Perkins ligne d'arbre, équipé de VHF Sondeur GPS, évier.

description:
Carène élancée, silhouette racée, lignes tendues, rouf bas et discret, qualité du gréement et de l’accastillage.
Vaste cockpit ouvert sur l’extérieur, doubles barres sur colonnes.
A l’intérieur, les aménagements sont étudiés pour le confort des propriétaires, et la noblesse des aménagements où le teck ciré est prédominant rappelle que le Centurion 40s.2 est un grand Wauquiez !
Grande raideur à la toile grâce au lest plomb à bulbe profond et à la carène puissante, entrées d'eau fines permettant un passage en douceur dans la mer. Toucher de barre efficace pour une navigation " plaisir ", plan de voilure élancé et généreux conférant un excellent niveau de performance à toutes les allures.

Le Centurion 40 S2 est un unité magnifique, faites pour tous les programmes !

Motorisé en 55CV Yanmar, hélice maxprop repliable. Version 2 Cabines, une salle d'eau et une soute arrière. Capote de roof
GV Full Batten trilam Taffetas, lazy bag, lazy jack, Spi asymétrique avec chaussettes, Genois sur enrouleur latté 112% Trilam
Winch Secondaire 46.2, un winch de roof électrique.
Capote de rouf large
Chauffage Webasto, pack électronique B and G (système de navigation complet (carte navionics XL9) Sonic Hub   interface PC, 1 écran 12" à la table à carte ainsi que VHF RS-25, Dans le cockpit : 1 écran multifonction 7" avec traceur bâbord, 2 répétiteur Triton à Tribord, commande de pilote, 1 VHF AHK5 extérieur sans fil, Pilote auto avec vérin Lecombe-Schmitt)
Kit mouillage complet (ancre delta 20kg, 30m de chaîne ø10   30m de câblot, 6 pare battages avec chaussettes noires, 4 amarres noires.

Très apprécié par les navigateurs au large, le Gin Fizz garde ses inconditionnels. Très bien conçu pour la vie en mer avec un espace de navigation particulièrement bien traité, le Gin Fizz offre un volume important, avec des performances conservées. Son aura de voilier de grande qualité aide au maintien d'une cote stabilisée.

En très bon état, de nombreux travaux ont été effectués (moteur changé pour un neuf, génois 4 ans,gréement dormant 2004...)

Orienté vers la croisière hauturière en famille, le remplaçant du 405 est incontestablement plus moderne avec son tableau arrière extra large assorti d’une immense plate-forme de bains et ses bouchains. Idem avec le rouf, dont les lignes sont plus affirmées, rappelant celles du 36 Performance. Le 410 est rapide et plaisant sous voiles, facile à manœuvrer grâce aux winches ramenés tout à l’arrière, à portée du barreur. Un voilier séduisant, disposant d'un espace de vie impressionnant, tout en gardant des performances sous voile ! Dufour à fait une très belle unité !

Oceanis 45 Version 2 cabines et grande soute, état très proche du neuf, tout à été protégé, taud de fermeture complet du cockpit avec capote, en très bon état, toile ferrari.
Motorisé en Yanmar 54 CV avec peu d'heures, Hélice JPro en sail-Drive, avec propulseur d'étrave, guindeau électrique.
Grand-Voile sur enrouleur, Génois et trinquette sur enrouleur, Spi assymétrique (Technifurl sur Emmagasineur) Winch de piano électrique sur babord.
2 Panneaux solaires 80W, Lecteur de carte GPS traceur Simrad, Radar, Pilote automatique, loch speedo sondeur, AIS, VHF, lecteur CD.
Eau chaude, prise eau sous pression, Chauffage, chargeur de quai et circuit 220V, Frigo et Conservateur (congélateur) WC électrique, Sellerie PVC, Sellerie dans le cockpit, table à carte modulable...

Une unité rare, dans un état exceptionnel, très équipé, très bien entretenu, LOA dispo.

La carène augmente les performances comparée aux modèles précédents, améliore la stabilité, et on trouve également plus de volume intérieur. Le cockpit est large, avec une grande plage de bain arrière, qui se ferme pour la navigation, des sièges spacieux... Tout est fait pour prendre du plaisir à vivre à bord. Le tout ici est protégé par les fermeture complètes extérieures, et avec une grande soute permettant de stocker tout ce qu'il faut pour partir !

AccommodationThe Sadler 29 offers six berths in two cabins. The forward cabin has a V berth with infill to create double berth, opening hatch to foredeck and stowage areas.Folding door separate heads compartment from the main cabin, to port with Jabsco marine toilet and washbasin. A large hanging locker opposite with lots of storage space.The saloon consisting of a dinette seating area to port which can convert to a double berth, removable table with drop leaves, settee berth to starboard. The chart table is aft to starboard with electrical distribution panel and a large quarter berth behind. Galley to port equipped with a 2-burner gimballed Plastimo Neptune gimballed gas cooker (2005) with grill and oven, coolbox, sink with manually pumped cold water supply and ample storage. 100 litre water tanks in one bag. Blue upholstery (2006) with complimenting curtains. The Sadler 29 has a large cockpit with lots of storage space and tiller steering, purpose made cockpit table. Sails and SparsMasthead rigged sloop. Kemp anodised aluminium deck stepped mast and boom. Spinnaker pole. Stainless steel standing rigging (2016) with backstay tensioner. Terylene running rigging (replaced as required). Slab reefing mainsail with stackpack. The main has three reefing points with two lines on each reef, all lines are led back to the cockpit so you can reef without leaving the cockpit. Furlex headsail furling system. Winches:    2 x Gibb Ratchet 28 sheet winches. (with winchers fitted)    2 x Lewmar 7 halyard winches.    1 x Gibb auto ratchet winch. Sails:    1 x Mainsail, (Dacron McWilliam Sails, approx. 1995, condition good)    1 x Genoa, (Hyde 2015 very good condition)    1 x Genoa (Dacron McWilliam Sails, approx. 1995, condition average)    1 x Storm Jib (year and make unknown, unused as new)Mechanical Systems Located abaft the companionway Bukh DV24ME 3-cylinder 24hp diesel engine. Seawater cooled. Single lever controls with electric start. Shaft drive to 3-bladed fixed propeller new 2015, with rope cutter. The engine was installed in approx. 1984 and was completely overhauled in 2005. Engine last serviced in 2018. 65 Litre fuel capacity in stainless steel tank giving approximately 200 miles range at 5 knots cruising speed. Maximum speed under power approximately 6.5 knots. Last out of water service winter of 2017/18. New shaft, stern gland, cutlass bearing 2017. New starter motor 2017, new fuel pipes, engine mounts, primary fuel filter 2018.   Electrical Systems2 x 12v batteries (1 x Engine + 1 x Domestic 2016) charging from engine alternator. 240v shorepower system with cable, and 240 volt ring mains.Deck Equipment    Anchor – Bruce with chain 40m and warp 20m    Sailcover – Blue    Sprayhood – Blue- (2006)    Cockpit dodgers with name on (2006)    Swim ladder – fixed stainless steel    5 x Mooring warps    8 x FendersNavigation Equipment    VHF – Vertex Standard (2006)    Echo Sounder – Raymarine ST60 (2012)    Log/speed – Raymarine ST60 (2012)    Windspeed – Raymarine ST60 (2012)    Compass – new 2015    Autopilot – Autohelm 2000    Chartplotter – Standard Horizon (2006) map update 2015    Clock & Barometer    Nav Lights    AIS Vesper Marine transponder with own screen (2016)Safety Equipment    3 x Fire Extinguisher    Fire Blanket    CO detector    Smoke alarm    2 x Jackstays    Cockpit harness points    Radar reflector    Lifebuoy    Liferaft (Seago 4 man 2018)    Emergency tiller    Manual bilge pump – Whale Keel/HullCast iron twin keel with transom hung rudder with tiller.ConstructionThis Sadler 29 was built by Sadler Yachts in 1981, but not launched until 1982 to a design by Martin Sadler. Light Blue GRP hull featuring the Sadler twin skin hull construction providing thermal and acoustic insulation and making the boat unsinkable. Light Blue GRP coachroof with painted non-slip decks. Cast iron twin keel. Tiller steering to transom hung rudder. Teak rubbing strake and grab rails.. Self-draining cockpit and anchor well. The hull was professionally epoxied below the waterline in 2007.Broker/Owners CommentsThis Sadler 29 is presented in good condition. It has been owned by the current owner since 2015 who is looking to upgrade to a larger boat.
